definition[0]: to change the way in which something is organized
example[0]: The company is planning to realign its sales operations.
definition[1]: to change the position of something slightly so that it is in the correct position in relation to something else
example[1]: You’ll have to realign your text columns.
definition[2]: if a government realigns its currency, it changes the currency’s value in relation to other currencies
example[2]: an attempt to get the yen realigned against the US dollar
definition[3]: to change the way that a company is organized
example[3]: The company will realign its marketing and sales activities.
